issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

comments.body: We should also remove any mention of the jetty-request log files.

[~sjones] any idea what I should do with the port references on this page:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#user-guide/elb_examples_backend_server_authentication.html ?? ("Using Elastic Load Balancing / Eucalyptus Load Balancing Usage Examples / Configuring Back-end Server Authentication" )

Removed references to 8443 and jetty-request log.

Pages still needing updates:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#admin-guide/region_examples.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#iam-guide/access_credentials.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#euca2ools-guide/euca_conf.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#admin-guide/cred_get.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#cloudformation/cf_overview.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#security-guide/security_bp_access.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#shared/credentials_admin.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#shared/credentials_user_existing.html

Question - what about references to eucarc? http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/#shared/source_eucarc.html and more ...
Unassigning from myself in case somebody else with technical background can jump in on this.
[~kmeredith], no updates are required for "Using Elastic Load Balancing / Eucalyptus Load Balancing Usage Examples  / Configuring Back-end Server Authentication" due to credential download changes.
Thank you [~sjones] - what about references to eucarc? http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/#shared/source_eucarc.html and more ... is that not related to this?
https://blog.devzero.com/2016/03/10/how-to-get-credentials-on-eucalyptus-4-2/ is worth reviewing again to see where we can improve.

All references to {code}euca_conf{code} and {code}euca-get-credentials{code} confirmed to be eliminated from -
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/index.html

Questions - 
1. *IAM Guide* - http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#iam-guide/access_initial_setup.html - "Generate Administrative Credentials" section still talks about the eucarc file.[Garrett's blog|https://blog.devzero.com/2016/03/10/how-to-get-credentials-on-eucalyptus-4-2/] might suggest the replacement in the "In with the New" section, but I'm not sure what to do. Or would a cross-reference to the [Install Guide section|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/credentials_admin_create.html] be enough? 
2. *Console Guide* - http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#shared/console_upgrade_deploy_elb.html - step 2b. has source eucarc file and I'm not sure how to update this. Help?
3. *User Guide* - http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#admin-guide/creds_create.html (even though the URL says admin, it is in user guide) - is this correct and complete enough from the user-persona perspective? I removed euca_conf reference and updated the command syntax.
4. *IAM Guide* - http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/credentials_user_new.html - very similar to the User Guide topic, above. If possible, we should _share_ one topic/content. Since it's IAM, I did not update it much (only replaced euca_conf with eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`). Are commands correct syntax?
5. *IAM Guide* - http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/credentials_user_existing.html - removed euca_conf admin method of accessing creds; not sure how to replace it? Also not sure if Console method stays the same? And should zip file references be deleted?
6. *SME REVIEW* - I would very much appreciate a closer-than-usual review of today's commit to ensure that my replacements and deletions are appropriate. Compare to equivalent 4.2.2 pages if you want to _see the difference in the docs_ (e.g., https://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/#shared/credentials_user_existing.html )
7. Future note - would be a nice improvement to refactor and tighten up credentials content across the doc set; it seems to have grown organically over time.
Hi [~sjones] sorry so much here ... if you do not have time, perhaps [~tony] can delegate this to someone extra-knowledgeable on creds ... thanks.

[~kmeredith], for Q1 we should probably replace the existing alice user creation example with a slightly modified version of the step 1 and 2 contents from the install guide. I think this would mean removing the existing "Create an Administrative User" and "Generate Administrative Credentials" sections and replacing with a new combined section based on "Create the Eucalyptus Cloud Administrator User" from the install guide. The install guide section could be copied with some changes, the command would become:

{code}
# euare-usercreate -wd DOMAIN alice >~/.euca/FILE.ini
{code}

step 1 and the notes around the command would be copied with minor changes (i.e. remove USER description, update DOMAIN description as we may not want to reference the install guide here).

step 3 for using the credentials would be in the form of an example:

{code}
# euare-userlistkeys --region alice@DOMAIN
{code}

so document to use the "--region alice@DOMAIN" to use the credentials and perhaps link to the euca2ools section on how to configure the default region and default users for a region:

http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/euca2ools_config_file_sections_global.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/euca2ools_config_file_sections_region.html

As noted above Q2 references internal scripts and needs revision (perhaps [~dkavanagh] has suggestions)

For Q3, I'd be inclined to remove the "Managing Access" / "Credentials" section entirely as "Managing Access" / "Users" already covers password credentials. The "Managing Access"  / "Credentials"  / "Upload a Certificate" could be moved under "Managing Access" / "Users" and then the "Managing Access" / "Users" / "Add a User" section should be updated to show how to create credentials when adding a users. There would be new sections under Managing Access" / "Users", for "Add an Access Key" and "Add an Certificate" that cover the command previously under the   "Managing Access" / "Credentials" / "Create Credentials" section (i.e. euare-useraddkey and euare-usercreatecert)

For Q4 we should remove the "Retrieving Existing User Credentials" section and otherwise the documentation would be similar to that suggested above, i.e. drop the "Manage Users and Groups" / "Access Tasks" / "Credentials" section and add content under "Manage Users and Groups" / "Access Tasks"  / "Users".

For Q5 remove "Retrieving Existing User Credentials" section as per Q4 comments.

Today's commit deals with Q1,3,4,5. ([~tvo] will work on Q2.) Available for viewing after 8 PM doc build.
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#iam-guide/eiam_task_oview.html
